bug.author: droidXrobot
bug.summary: Brains are missing in new commit
bug.description:
Describe the bug When you import UnitySDK for the first time the examples are missing brains. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Git clone the repo Open Unity SDK as a new project' Open an example project Notice brain dirs are missing
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS + version: Windows 10 ML-Agents version: (e.g. ML-Agents v0.8, or latest develop branch from source) TensorFlow version: (you can run pip3 show tensorflow to get this) Environment: (which example environment you used to reproduce the error)

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/droidXrobot>@droidXrobot</denchmark-link> , This is a known issue if you’ve opened the project with unity 2019.2.x or later. I’ll try to find the issue to link back to. In the mean time, the work around is to hook up the brains manually. We hope to fix this in the coming weeks. I will close this issue for now and update it when the fix is available. Cheers.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/surfnerd>@surfnerd</denchmark-link> , Could you tell me how you hook up the brains manually?
Which version of ML-Agents do you have?
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/surfnerd>@surfnerd</denchmark-link> , The version is 0.11.0. I install it from pip. The version for Unity is 2019.2.12f1. Thanks.
